About.label: History
About.value: Full Sail University began 1979 in Dayton, Ohio, as an audio recording workshop. It provided unparalleled opportunity for students to become familiar with the industry through real-world experience in professional studio environments. Full Sail eventually relocated to Central Florida, planting roots in its current Winter Park location in 1989.

About.label: Education
About.value: Full Sail’s mission is to provide students with an innovative style of education, delivered by a staff of dedicated individuals, that addresses the career opportunities available in an ever-growing, constantly evolving industry. We do this by developing unique curricula that combine elements of creativity, art, business and life skills, technical prowess, and academic achievement. Our education is delivered via immersive teaching methods, both in Full Sail’s real-world production studios and classrooms, as well as through our online learning environment.

About.label: Career
About.value: Career development is a cornerstone of your education at Full Sail, whether you’re attending on campus or online. From innovative programs like Global Professionalism Standard (GPS), to specific Career Modules that will equip you with career strategies, to ongoing access to our Career Development specialists, we provide you with the tools to take charge of your career goals, both during your education and after graduation.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: International students may be assisted by the International Student Center in matters regarding visa status. International students are welcome to seek assistance with issues of daily living such as opening bank accounts, obtaining driver’s licenses and medical insurance. The International Student Center works closely with other Full Sail staff members to ensure a smooth transition for students from other countries attending Full Sail.

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: Full Sail University is committed to the needs of our students. We recognize the need for suitable housing, compatible roommates, home furnishings, and guidance for a successful relocation. The Housing Department was developed with those needs in mind. Our job is to help you make a smooth transition to the Winter Park area.The Housing team has many years of experience preparing thousands of students for on-campus learning by tracking and guiding housing plans. We can assist in offering an array of housing and roommate options to help meet your goals with off-campus living arrangements.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: The Academic Success Department provides services through Academic Advising, Student Records, Student Success Seminars, Global Professionalism Standards, and the Library. We work closely with the faculty to ensure the best support services for all students.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: Full Sail Support Specialists can assist with resolving technical issues associated with the functionality of the online platform.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: Full Sail’s campus is located in Winter Park, Florida, just outside of Orlando. It’s a college area through and through – young, eclectic, with lots to offer students.

StudentLife.label: Student clubs
StudentLife.value: Whatever your interests, there's a club or organization you can connect with at Full Sail. Our student groups include the Student Community Association (SCA), Black Student Union, International Student Society, Veteran Student Union, Pride Club, Extra Life, and many more. You can also get involved with Pure Motivation – a club built around community involvement and volunteerism – and SPARK, a student production agency that gives selected students an opportunity to work on non-academic projects for outside clients.

The selling point of this university is its accelerated program in which you can obtain a Bachelors Degree in less time.

About.label: Education
About.value: GBSB Global is dedicated to preparing students for the careers of the global economy. GBSB Global has a strong focus on innovation and technology, both in our online and on-campus programs. We are within a few business schools in Europe to offer a fully digitalized experience to our students throughout the learning process; this includes digital touch boards in all classrooms, collaborative apps, inclusive learning environment, and various educational digital tools.

About.label: Career
About.value: At GBSB Global Business School our vision is to be a leading innovative business school, developing transformational ideas and professionals that shape the future of business.Our Career Services team will support you throughout your studies and beyond to ensure you achieve your full potential. You will connect your goals and values and discover the influencing, communication and leadership skills you need to actively manage and accelerate your career.Career development is a journey. Wherever you are in the process – from starting a graduate job to considering changing industries – GBSB Global offers assistance to help students plan and achieve career success.

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: Accommodation is not included in the program fees; however, we have an agreement with several student lodge services to help you find the most suitable arrangement for when you arrive to either Spain or Malta.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: Barcelona is one of the most visited cities in Europe, attracting tourists, business travelers and students seeking to study abroad in Spain. Here are reasons why you should study business in Barcelona.Madrid is the capital of Spain and the largest city on the peninsula. It is the official political and economic center of the country and a mecca for academics and the arts from all over the world. Here are some of the many reasons why you should study at GBSB Global Business School in Madrid.GBSB Global Business School in Malta is a state recognized institution that provides business education in English to students from around the world.

About.label: History
About.value: In 1969 one ambition changed the world, giving anyone, anywhere the power to learn. Established by the Royal Charter (pdf 235kb) and globally recognised, The Open University has pioneered distance learning for over 50 years, delivering exceptional teaching and outstanding support to students across the UK and the world.

About.label: Education
About.value: Our qualifications range from certificates, diplomas and short courses to undergraduate and postgraduate degrees.Whatever you want to study, we’re sure to have the right course for you.

About.label: Research
About.value: Choose the research degree area closest to your field of interest to find out about the department, its research priorities and philosophy, the research environment, and facilities available.Within each research area is a list of topics which tell you more about specific areas of research, current and prospective projects, entry requirements, available supervisors and contact details for advice.

About.label: Career
About.value: An Open University qualification is attractive to employers.Employers know that many of our students study while working. Therefore, they’re aware that Open University study can be challenging, and that it requires you to develop a variety of valuable skills and qualities – all of which will be assets to any workplace.You’ll also be attractive to employers because, being an Open University graduate, you’ll stand out from the crowd of conventional campus-based university graduates.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: The OU has offices throughout the UK where your student support teams are based.et in touch with our student ambassadors who can tell you more about what you can expect from studying with The Open University

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: The University doesn't own student housing, but can offer some help on finding private accommodation off campus.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: OU Researchers and research students have access to a world class collection of online resources, a document delivery service, and guidance on skills development.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: Using a computer is a regular part of your OU study, so here's information on a range of computing topics.

About.label: History
About.value: We are one of the longest-running providers of wholly online degrees in the UK and we’ve put over a decade of expertise to good use in designing our programmes. The University of Essex Online achieves excellence for teaching, learning and academic support in the 2023 National Student Survey (NSS).

About.label: Education
About.value: Our programmes are specifically designed for online delivery, combining gold standard teaching with the latest technology and enabling you to study from anywhere in the world.All our qualifications are awarded and validated by the University of Essex, an award-winning university with a 60-year heritage of teaching and research excellence. On completion of your studies, you’ll be invited to graduate at the University of Essex’s Colchester campus. You will receive the same certificate as campus-based students – your mode of study is only mentioned on your academic transcript.

About.label: Research
About.value: Our online tutors are specialists in their respective fields. They are passionate about what they teach and combine their knowledge of industry practice with high-quality academic delivery, offering you an unparalleled learning experience.

About.label: Career
About.value: Whether you're an experienced professional looking to progress your career or a recent graduate who wants to boost their CV, online study is a cost-effective, convenient and flexible way to get ahead.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: Our team of dedicated student advisers and study skills specialists provide world-class mentoring and academic support to you from your first day to graduation. The team will be on hand to help and guide you as you progress through your studies. Whatever the question or issue, they will work with you to find a solution.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: Your course will be delivered through a state-of-the-art virtual learning environment, which provides you with 24/7 access to high-quality resources, including lecturecasts, discussion forums, live seminars and Q&A sessions, as well as an eLibrary. Even your assessments will be completed entirely online – there’s no need for you to travel to an assessment centre!

Reviews.content: An absolutely fantastic experience!

About.value: Since its foundation in the historic city of Newcastle upon Tyne, Northumbria has developed into a successful regional, national, and international institution. Formed in 1969 from the amalgamation of three regional colleges, the Polytechnic became one of the leading institutions of its type in the UK. It was awarded university status in September 1992 and became Northumbria University.

We offer highly rated courses with many programmes accredited by professional bodies. Our courses are at the forefront of real-world current knowledge and practice and informed by global perspectives and research to shape and enrich our teaching. You’ll learn from inspiring and passionate academics who are pioneers in their areas of expertise. Our lecturers boost our student's independence, build their transferable skills, and develop their critical thinking. To ensure students receive the best of what Northumbria has to offer, our staff are committed to delivering outstanding teaching experiences enriched through successful partnerships and collaborative working with external organisations.

Ranked top 25 in the UK for the research power (Research Excellence Framework, 2021) Northumbria is a research-intensive university with a proud heritage of making a difference to individuals and to society. We have a number of areas where our research is truly outstanding and is shaping knowledge and practice around the world. We call these our Peaks of Research Excellence. Focused and cohesive areas of outstanding research they are a vital part of our vibrant research landscape. Collaborating with external partners is a vital part of the research process and we encourage existing and new potential partners to reach out.

We are ranked top 30 in England for career prospects, both for the number of students achieving a First or 2:1 grade and for the above average number of students in high-skilled jobs or further study within 15 months of leaving (Guardian University Guide, 2024). More than 430 employers sponsor our students, and more than 50 professional bodies accredit our programmes, ensuring that they are relevant and up-to-date.  This is one of the highest figures in the UK, meaning our students are ‘work ready’ when they graduate. We were praised for this in the Which? University Student Survey 2018 which ranked us as one of the top-rated universities for ‘job readiness’.

Services.value: As well as the academic support from your tutors, there are teams of people who are there to help you reach the point of graduation feeling nurtured, fulfilled, and supported at every step of your student journey. Our friendly and specialist Student Life and Wellbeing advisors are here to offer support, whatever your needs and circumstances, such as around disability issues, faith issues, counselling and mental health support, finance and funding, welfare issues and international student support. Our Graduate Futures team are also there to help you achieve your career ambitions, make the most of your experiences, develop your skills and manage your future.

At Northumbria, we understand that where you live is a big aspect of your student life. We have over 3,000 rooms that are available either self-catered or catered and the majority of accommodation is a few minutes’ walk from campus. When applying for accommodation, you can choose the exact room, floor and residence online based on real-time availability, and view your flat occupancy before you arrive to find out if your flatmates are male or female, undergraduate or postgraduate, UK or international, and use social media to connect with them. We also provide free 1GB broadband in all Northumbria University accommodation.

One of the best academic libraries in the UK, with around half a million print books, over 900,000 e-books and around 85,000 e-journals, our library provides learning spaces to meet a variety of needs, from silent or quiet study, through to social and collaborative learning. Open 24/7 during term-time, the award-winning building has held the UK Customer Service Excellence (CSE) standard since 2010.

Ranked 10th in the UK for Facilities (WhatUni Student Choice Awards, 2024), students have access to modern labs, workshops, CAD suites, media labs and classrooms with all the necessary IT facilities to achieve the best education possible. There’s also plenty of study spaces, digital hubs and touch down spaces, including our Digital Commons. IT support is also available 24/7 to assist with any queries.

Your health matters. We’re there to guide, signpost and support you. Our Accessibility & Inclusion, Counselling & Mental Health, Wellbeing, Chaplaincy & Faith and International Student Support services hold the Customer Service Excellence award accredited by the Home Office. We also recommend registering with a Doctor (GP), as it’s essential for medical support while you’re in the UK.

StudentLife.value: We want students to make the most of our fantastic campus and feel safe and supported and ready to make the most of life at university. Ranked 9th in the UK for Student Life (WhatUni Student Choice Awards, 2024), our City campus is based in Newcastle’s city centre with Coach Lane Campus a mere 7-minute drive out of the city. On each Campus there are a range of cafes that serve hot and cold food which can be pre-ordered via an app, and places to meet up with friends, including bars at the City Campus Students’ Union. We also have a wide array of learning spaces available, where students can meet, study, and collaborate, including our Digital Commons.

Whether you just want to get fit and have fun, or whether you’re a talented athlete, Northumbria Sport has something for everyone - from our performance sport programme through to the clubs and leagues, or as a member of our award-winning Volunteering and Internship programme. Our City Campus flagship £30 million Sports Central is home to a state-of-the-art fitness centre, squash courts, a sprint track, six-lane 25m swimming pool, a number of high-quality outdoor pitches, sauna, steam room, exercise classes and sports clubs, plus much more. The main Sports Central arena can also hold up to 3,000 spectators.

The Students’ Union is run by students for students, and offers a range of services and activities, including over 100 clubs and societies covering a range of interests and cultural beliefs, as well as volunteering opportunities. Recently voted by students as being in the Top 20 Best Student Unions by the Student Crowd Awards, 2023. We also have a new initiative, ‘Be Part of It’, which is a programme of activities exclusive to Northumbria students and offers a fantastic opportunity for new experiences, to make friends and have the best experience while you are here with us. This also includes discounted tickets for a huge variety of activities including paddle boarding, cocktail making and theatre visits.

Reviews.title: Best Uni in the north east
Reviews.content: Northumbria University is the best University in the North east of England. our lecturers have a full grasp of the courses and they deliver it seamlessly...

Reviews.title: room for more guidance
Reviews.content: There was a lot of freedom to explore and develop my own creativity. However, I felt that there could have been more evaluation, guidance, and follow-up for the students. Despite this, the program still offered numerous opportunities for personal growth, and I constantly felt encouraged to push my boundaries and enhance my skills.

About.label: History
About.value: We are one of the longest-running providers of wholly online degrees in the UK and we’ve put over a decade of expertise to good use in designing our programmes. The University of Essex Online achieves excellence for teaching, learning and academic support in the 2023 National Student Survey (NSS).

About.label: Education
About.value: Our programmes are specifically designed for online delivery, combining gold standard teaching with the latest technology and enabling you to study from anywhere in the world.All our qualifications are awarded and validated by the University of Essex, an award-winning university with a 60-year heritage of teaching and research excellence. On completion of your studies, you’ll be invited to graduate at the University of Essex’s Colchester campus. You will receive the same certificate as campus-based students – your mode of study is only mentioned on your academic transcript.

About.label: Research
About.value: Our online tutors are specialists in their respective fields. They are passionate about what they teach and combine their knowledge of industry practice with high-quality academic delivery, offering you an unparalleled learning experience.

About.label: Career
About.value: Whether you're an experienced professional looking to progress your career or a recent graduate who wants to boost their CV, online study is a cost-effective, convenient and flexible way to get ahead.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: Our team of dedicated student advisers and study skills specialists provide world-class mentoring and academic support to you from your first day to graduation. The team will be on hand to help and guide you as you progress through your studies. Whatever the question or issue, they will work with you to find a solution.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: Your course will be delivered through a state-of-the-art virtual learning environment, which provides you with 24/7 access to high-quality resources, including lecturecasts, discussion forums, live seminars and Q&A sessions, as well as an eLibrary. Even your assessments will be completed entirely online – there’s no need for you to travel to an assessment centre!

Reviews.title: Go Big or Go Home!
Reviews.content: An absolutely fantastic experience!

About.label: History
About.value: In 1969 one ambition changed the world, giving anyone, anywhere the power to learn. Established by the Royal Charter (pdf 235kb) and globally recognised, The Open University has pioneered distance learning for over 50 years, delivering exceptional teaching and outstanding support to students across the UK and the world.

About.label: Education
About.value: Our qualifications range from certificates, diplomas and short courses to undergraduate and postgraduate degrees.Whatever you want to study, we’re sure to have the right course for you.

About.label: Research
About.value: Choose the research degree area closest to your field of interest to find out about the department, its research priorities and philosophy, the research environment, and facilities available.Within each research area is a list of topics which tell you more about specific areas of research, current and prospective projects, entry requirements, available supervisors and contact details for advice.

About.label: Career
About.value: An Open University qualification is attractive to employers.Employers know that many of our students study while working. Therefore, they’re aware that Open University study can be challenging, and that it requires you to develop a variety of valuable skills and qualities – all of which will be assets to any workplace.You’ll also be attractive to employers because, being an Open University graduate, you’ll stand out from the crowd of conventional campus-based university graduates.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: The OU has offices throughout the UK where your student support teams are based.et in touch with our student ambassadors who can tell you more about what you can expect from studying with The Open University

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: The University doesn't own student housing, but can offer some help on finding private accommodation off campus.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: OU Researchers and research students have access to a world class collection of online resources, a document delivery service, and guidance on skills development.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: Using a computer is a regular part of your OU study, so here's information on a range of computing topics.

Reviews.title: Great university
Reviews.content: I like the way it is organised and set out with guidance notes and plenty of opportunity to ask for help by your tutor, on tutorials and on the forums.

Reviews.title: Incredible university
Reviews.content: My experience with my fellow classmates, tutors, and the online portal have been fantastic. The portal includes mutiple guides in the Help Center and Computing Guide which are extremely helpful. About.label: Education
About.value: GBSB Global is dedicated to preparing students for the careers of the global economy. GBSB Global has a strong focus on innovation and technology, both in our online and on-campus programs. We are within a few business schools in Europe to offer a fully digitalized experience to our students throughout the learning process; this includes digital touch boards in all classrooms, collaborative apps, inclusive learning environment, and various educational digital tools.

About.label: Career
About.value: At GBSB Global Business School our vision is to be a leading innovative business school, developing transformational ideas and professionals that shape the future of business.Our Career Services team will support you throughout your studies and beyond to ensure you achieve your full potential. You will connect your goals and values and discover the influencing, communication and leadership skills you need to actively manage and accelerate your career.Career development is a journey. Wherever you are in the process – from starting a graduate job to considering changing industries – GBSB Global offers assistance to help students plan and achieve career success.

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: Accommodation is not included in the program fees; however, we have an agreement with several student lodge services to help you find the most suitable arrangement for when you arrive to either Spain or Malta.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: Barcelona is one of the most visited cities in Europe, attracting tourists, business travelers and students seeking to study abroad in Spain. Here are reasons why you should study business in Barcelona.Madrid is the capital of Spain and the largest city on the peninsula. It is the official political and economic center of the country and a mecca for academics and the arts from all over the world. Here are some of the many reasons why you should study at GBSB Global Business School in Madrid.GBSB Global Business School in Malta is a state recognized institution that provides business education in English to students from around the world.

Reviews.title: Small but quality
Reviews.content: I like small class groups and the opportunity to have a private session with teachers when it's necessary. Also, I enjoy the useful campus location and a lot of activities for students. It helps us, international students, to adapt faster to a new country and culture. But, at the same time, my business school's campus isn't large and it's brand-new,...

It was not only quick and efficient, but the representative also demonstrated a strong commitment to addressing all my questions as promptly as possible. The responsiveness and thoroughness of the service added a great deal to my positive...

name: Kogod School of Business, American University Washington DC

About.label: Education
About.value: American University is home to the Kogod School of Business, where we use business as a force for meaningful change. Our students feel empowered to use the knowledge, skills, and experience that a Kogod education provides to make a difference in their communities. Our graduates continue on as professional leaders in the corporate, non-profit, government, and social service organizations.Kogod provides a diverse and inclusive environment, much like you will encounter in the global business world. Students work alongside professors and peers to further understand the complexities of business. Our programs are centered around experiential and applied learning because we know the best way to learn is through practice. Turn your aspirations into outcomes with the support of our impassioned faculty and staff!

On completion of your studies, you’ll be invited to graduate at the University of Essex’s Colchester campus. You will receive the same certificate as campus-based students – your mode of study is only mentioned on your academic transcript.

About.label: Research
About.value: Our online tutors are specialists in their respective fields. They are passionate about what they teach and combine their knowledge of industry practice with high-quality academic delivery, offering you an unparalleled learning experience.

About.label: Career
About.value: Whether you're an experienced professional looking to progress your career or a recent graduate who wants to boost their CV, online study is a cost-effective, convenient and flexible way to get ahead.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: Our team of dedicated student advisers and study skills specialists provide world-class mentoring and academic support to you from your first day to graduation. The team will be on hand to help and guide you as you progress through your studies. Whatever the question or issue, they will work with you to find a solution.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: Your course will be delivered through a state-of-the-art virtual learning environment, which provides you with 24/7 access to high-quality resources, including lecturecasts, discussion forums, live seminars and Q&A sessions, as well as an eLibrary. Even your assessments will be completed entirely online – there’s no need for you to travel to an assessment centre!

About.label: History
About.value: In 1969 one ambition changed the world, giving anyone, anywhere the power to learn. Established by the Royal Charter (pdf 235kb) and globally recognised, The Open University has pioneered distance learning for over 50 years, delivering exceptional teaching and outstanding support to students across the UK and the world.

About.label: Education
About.value: Our qualifications range from certificates, diplomas and short courses to undergraduate and postgraduate degrees.Whatever you want to study, we’re sure to have the right course for you.

About.label: Research
About.value: Choose the research degree area closest to your field of interest to find out about the department, its research priorities and philosophy, the research environment, and facilities available.Within each research area is a list of topics which tell you more about specific areas of research, current and prospective projects, entry requirements, available supervisors and contact details for advice.

About.label: Career
About.value: An Open University qualification is attractive to employers.Employers know that many of our students study while working. Therefore, they’re aware that Open University study can be challenging, and that it requires you to develop a variety of valuable skills and qualities – all of which will be assets to any workplace.You’ll also be attractive to employers because, being an Open University graduate, you’ll stand out from the crowd of conventional campus-based university graduates.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: The OU has offices throughout the UK where your student support teams are based.et in touch with our student ambassadors who can tell you more about what you can expect from studying with The Open University

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: The University doesn't own student housing, but can offer some help on finding private accommodation off campus.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: OU Researchers and research students have access to a world class collection of online resources, a document delivery service, and guidance on skills development.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: Using a computer is a regular part of your OU study, so here's information on a range of computing topics.

About.label: History
About.value: Derby as a region is renowned for its heritage of innovation and creativity and is the home to leading global brands such as Rolls-Royce, Alstom and Toyota. Strong industry links and state-of-the-art facilities mean that you will build the practical and transferable skills you need to succeed, whatever path you choose.

About.label: Research
About.value: Through our ground-breaking research, we are combatting the most prevalent challenges in our society and shaping a better future, today. This research inspires our curriculum and creates relevant, up-to-date modules containing real-world learnings which our students can apply to their future workplace.Our academic research themes cover areas of critical importance for the future and include:Biomedical and clinical scienceCreative and cultural industriesData scienceBusiness, economic and social policyPublic servicesZero carbon

About.label: Career
About.value: At Derby, we believe in powering the next generation of thought leaders. This means that you don’t just gain the academic qualifications for a job, you acquire the skills, resilience, and experiences for a meaningful and impactful career.Career experts are there to guide, support and advise. Whether you need help with placement applications, enhancing your CV or finding work experience, the University will be by your side every step of the way, making sure you’re on the path to success.The outstanding Careers teams provide an accredited service and are proud to confirm that 96% of our UK graduates are in employment or further study (HESA Graduate Outcomes 20/21).

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: Moving to university is a new and exciting chapter in your life, but it can also feel like a big and sometimes scary step – especially if this is your first time living away from home. We have a team of friendly, caring and supportive staff who are trained to help with specific concerns around your course or wellbeing or simply to provide that little piece of reassurance you may need.We’re here for you and are always on hand to help make your university experience the best it can possibly be.

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: The University has been awarded Best University Housing for three years running and Best Environmental Management for two years running, as voted for by students in the Global Student Living Awards 2024. The University’s undergraduate halls are all conveniently located close to the city centre and to the teaching spaces that are spread across Derby, making it the perfect place to begin your student journey. All accommodation at the University of Derby is inclusive of bills, meaning you do not need to worry about hidden extra costs. At the University of Derby, student wellbeing is the top priority, and all accommodation is installed with CCTV and an intercom entry system.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: The University provides access to library resources (print and online), information technology and study space to support students in their studies. Help and advice is available throughout the year from friendly and knowledgeable staff. There are computers and printers available on every floor of the Library.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: There are computers available to students within the Library and laptops that can be borrowed. Students also have access to the Microsoft suite to support their university work. IT services are available to students that have any queries about this.

Services.label: Medical services
Services.value: The University of Derby has its own on-site doctor’s surgery at Kedleston Road.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: The University of Derby is spread across several teaching and learning sites, located in or near the city centre. Derby is a relatively small city which means that all sites are conveniently within walking distance from the halls of residence and the city centre. For those rainy days, you can hop on one of our handy Unibuses which will get you from A to B.Our main site is at Kedleston Road and features an outstanding Sports Centre, a four-storey library, a Multi-faith Centre and the Union of Students. You’ll also find lots of popular eateries including Starbucks and Subway.The University of Derby also has a site in Chesterfield which is recognised as a Centre of Excellence for Health and Social Care.

StudentLife.label: Sports facilities
StudentLife.value: The University of Derby Sports Centre is open to students, staff and the wider community all year round. Students can join as a member from as little as £99 for the year, but many of the activities and facilities are also available on a pay-as-you-go basis. There is a superb fitness suite and a range of weekly classes on offer and social sport activities to enjoy, keeping students healthy and well. Other top quality facilities include: squash courts, double-sized sports hall, indoor climbing wall, external 3G pitches and two outdoor tennis courts.

StudentLife.label: Student clubs
StudentLife.value: Societies are run by students, for students, and are a great way for you to meet like-minded people, learn a new skill or try out a new hobby. You’ll find everything from Warhammer to Medieval Re-enactment, Afro Caribbean to Ballroom and Latin Dance – and if there’s not something on our societies list that catches your eye, you’ll have the freedom and support to set up your own society.Each society offers organised activities to enhance your social experience, including bar crawls, quizzes and day trips.

Reviews.title: University of Derby
Reviews.content: I am looking forward to joining the university of Derby. From the interview process that I had I am convinced that it's the best fit for me. I like the structure of modules and clinical placements that will prepare us for Music therapy field.

Reviews.title: The best
Reviews.content: It's fantastic degree with the best teachers peaceful and leader's

name: University of Texas at Austin McCombs School of Business

About.label: History
About.value: Before McCombs became a standalone school in 1922, faculty and students met in cold classrooms with fire in their bellies. In 2018, we opened Robert B. Rowling Hall, our newest site of learning. With great thinkers, game-changing gifts, and a lot of heart, we grow and evolve with each passing year.

About.label: Education
About.value: A degree from Texas McCombs is your passport to the world. You will learn, you will grow, you will explore, and you will make an impact. Your courses are taught by professors on the cutting edge of business, and they value hands-on learning. At McCombs, you’ll find opportunities to participate in projects that can change how business is done across the globe.Our academic philosophy is grounded in understanding how organizations influence the people they serve. Faculty, centers, and work-study partnerships create new insights of human behavior through research and analysis. Socially engaged learning sharpens our students' business instincts and emotional intelligence.

About.label: Research
About.value: Our faculty members are the visionaries of then and now. Tap into your promise when you connect your enterprising spirit with globally respected individuals and assist with research and insights.

About.label: Career
About.value: By graduating from McCombs, you unlock a network of more than 100,000 living alumni and resources to help plan your career. We also provide ongoing learning opportunities to help our alumni blaze trails throughout their careers.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: The Office of Student Life offers a host of opportunities to connect with your peers, participate in community events, and be a part of your school, your city, and your world.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: Wireless internet access is available in most of the business school complex, including the CBA, GSB and FAC buildings.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: Forty Acres of intellectual freedom drive the heartbeat of our campus. We teach and learn through active engagement and rigorous scientific research. We’re on a road to solve the world’s most challenging problems. In a university system that is granted more patents each year than any other, that’s not brag — it’s fact.

StudentLife.label: Student clubs
StudentLife.value: Student organizations are built on a particular area of interest and are appropriate for any McCombs students who share that interest.

About.label: History
About.value: Since its founding in 1972 by the six original members of the then European Communities, the European University Institute (EUI) has earned a reputation as a leading international academic institution with a European focus.

About.label: Education
About.value: The four departments – Economics, History and Civilisation, Law, and Political and Social Sciences – host scholars from more than 100 countries, studying for the Institution’s doctorate, the one-year Master in Law or the Master of Research in Economics.

About.label: Research
About.value: EUI’s research programmes and projects produce cutting-edge work in a wide range of fields and disciplines. Research activities at the EUI cover projects, seminars, workshops, conferences and summer schools that enhance intellectual discourse and debate.EUI members and their projects address many of the major challenges that face Europe and the world, and their objectives are to lead the international agenda across the EUI’s disciplinary spectrum and through interdisciplinary initiatives.EUI’s world-leading academics and researchers develop the Institute’s existing strengths and new lines of intellectual enquiry. The EUI encourages its academic community to reach their full potential in research, enhancing their career development with clear performance standards and high-quality support.

About.label: Career
About.value: The European University Institute (EUI) is situated on the hills of Fiesole, overlooking Florence, Italy. It is a challenging and rewarding workplace for more than 1000 people, hailing from more than 100 countries across the globe. The Institute hosts around 550 PhD researchers, more than 125 postdoctoral and senior fellows, around 150 full- and part-time professors, research staff of around 135 and administrative staff of almost 220 members.The EUI’s distinctly international environment provides exceptional opportunities for academics and researchers across disciplines and borders.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: The EUI - European University Institute Counselling Service offers you a professional, secure and friendly space where you can talk about whatever is worrying you, with total respect for your values, choices and lifestyle.

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: The EUI owns and manages 71 apartments located near the Institute. The EUI Housing Office organizes the allocation of the EUI residential apartments (PAB and PDM) and provides, through FHS (Florence Housing Service), selected following a call for expression of interest, assistance to all members of the EUI Community in finding long and short term accommodation on the private market in and around Florence.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: More than forty years of investment in collections, services and infrastructure, have resulted in an internationally recognised social science research library, valued for its multi-national character and the high quality of its collections with a special emphasis on Europe.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: The primary aim of the Information and Communication Technology Service (ICT) is to support the European University Institute (EUI) and its community in pursuing teaching and research at the highest university level.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: The European University Institute is seated on the Tuscan hillside overlooking Florence and close to Fiesole.Many of the villas date from the Renaissance period and have been restored along with their landscaped gardens. Newly-built residencies for researchers are a welcome addition to the EUI campus.

StudentLife.label: Sports facilities
StudentLife.value: The EUI Gym can be reached by following the road down the hill from the Badia car parks to Via Roccettini. It is a small white building on the left with an adjacent basketball court.EUI members wishing to access the gym must attend a compulsory induction course. Everyone is welcome to register.

About.label: History
About.value: Since its founding in 1972 by the six original members of the then European Communities, the European University Institute (EUI) has earned a reputation as a leading international academic institution with a European focus.

About.label: Education
About.value: The four departments – Economics, History and Civilisation, Law, and Political and Social Sciences – host scholars from more than 100 countries, studying for the Institution’s doctorate, the one-year Master in Law or the Master of Research in Economics.

About.label: Research
About.value: EUI’s research programmes and projects produce cutting-edge work in a wide range of fields and disciplines. Research activities at the EUI cover projects, seminars, workshops, conferences and summer schools that enhance intellectual discourse and debate.EUI members and their projects address many of the major challenges that face Europe and the world, and their objectives are to lead the international agenda across the EUI’s disciplinary spectrum and through interdisciplinary initiatives.EUI’s world-leading academics and researchers develop the Institute’s existing strengths and new lines of intellectual enquiry. The EUI encourages its academic community to reach their full potential in research, enhancing their career development with clear performance standards and high-quality support.

About.label: Career
About.value: The European University Institute (EUI) is situated on the hills of Fiesole, overlooking Florence, Italy. It is a challenging and rewarding workplace for more than 1000 people, hailing from more than 100 countries across the globe. The Institute hosts around 550 PhD researchers, more than 125 postdoctoral and senior fellows, around 150 full- and part-time professors, research staff of around 135 and administrative staff of almost 220 members.The EUI’s distinctly international environment provides exceptional opportunities for academics and researchers across disciplines and borders.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: The EUI - European University Institute Counselling Service offers you a professional, secure and friendly space where you can talk about whatever is worrying you, with total respect for your values, choices and lifestyle.

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: The EUI owns and manages 71 apartments located near the Institute. The EUI Housing Office organizes the allocation of the EUI residential apartments (PAB and PDM) and provides, through FHS (Florence Housing Service), selected following a call for expression of interest, assistance to all members of the EUI Community in finding long and short term accommodation on the private market in and around Florence.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: More than forty years of investment in collections, services and infrastructure, have resulted in an internationally recognised social science research library, valued for its multi-national character and the high quality of its collections with a special emphasis on Europe.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: The primary aim of the Information and Communication Technology Service (ICT) is to support the European University Institute (EUI) and its community in pursuing teaching and research at the highest university level.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: The European University Institute is seated on the Tuscan hillside overlooking Florence and close to Fiesole.Many of the villas date from the Renaissance period and have been restored along with their landscaped gardens. Newly-built residencies for researchers are a welcome addition to the EUI campus.

StudentLife.label: Sports facilities
StudentLife.value: The EUI Gym can be reached by following the road down the hill from the Badia car parks to Via Roccettini. It is a small white building on the left with an adjacent basketball court.EUI members wishing to access the gym must attend a compulsory induction course. Everyone is welcome to register.

About.label: History
About.value: Ponce Health Sciences University’s history dates back to its founding in 1977 in Ponce, Puerto Rico. We’ve been expanding our prestigious health sciences offerings since, with a focus on graduate medical education programs.

About.label: Education
About.value: The graduate programs at PHSU St. Louis are rooted in educating culturally-competent healthcare professionals to become physicians, doctors, and clinical psychology professionals.

About.label: Research
About.value: The MSMS and PsyD programs are designed to equip our students with the knowledge to take their next step — whether that’s an MD program or entering the workforce with a science-based education.

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: Ponce Health Sciences University (PHSU) is an institution of higher education committed to the well-being of students in all aspects of their life. Our purpose is to provide services to students under “The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990” and its amendments. Also, in compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act 1973.Reasonable accommodation: “Modifications or adjustments to the tasks, environment or to the way things are usually done that enable individuals with disabilities to have an equal opportunity to participate in an academic program or a job.” (U.S. Department of Education, 2007).

Services.label: Medical services
Services.value: The practice of Professional Counseling is the application of mental health, psychological, or human development principles, through cognitive, affective, behavioral or systematic intervention strategies, that address wellness, personal growth, or career development, as well as pathology.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: Ponce Health Sciences University aims to provide world-class, culturally-competent health sciences education to the people we serve, including populations that are historically underrepresented in professional health sciences. PHSU is focused on the disciplines of Medicine, Clinical Psychology, Biomedical Sciences and Public Health. For decades, PHSU been recognized in Puerto Rico and abroad for our educational and research achievements in health sciences and contributing to our community.

About.label: History
About.value: The UOC was created in 1995 as the world's first university with a virtual campus, which allowed its students to study at any time from any location. The University continually uses cutting-edge e-learning research and innovation to refine the UOC methodology. This is possible thanks to UOC R&I and its 50 plus research groups, as well as the eLearning Innovation Center, which drives innovation.

About.label: Education
About.value: The UOC's methodology – its proprietary learning model – combines learning activities and projects, customized teaching support, and teamwork. The students set their own pace in accordance with their needs, facilitating a good work-life balance.The teaching materials are available in a variety of formats so that students can make the most of the time they spend learning.We work to ensure that they are presented in an innovative way so that students can see what they have to do to pass each course, how long it will take and what resources are available when working on them.

About.label: Research
About.value: The eLearning Innovation Center (eLinC) is at the heart of the UOC's mission to transform education and continue improving lifelong learning online.Learning through transformation, with and for teachers and students.Research focused where technology and social & human sciences converge.The UOC has 2 research centres, one centre for innovation and learning transformation and a Doctoral School and also conducts research in the fields of its seven faculties.More than 50 research groupsMore than 500 researchers

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: The UOC Library is a centre for digital resources, with a team of over 50 experts who lend their services to students, faculty, researchers and administrative staff. Regardless of the task at hand, the Library remains steady in its commitment to high-quality learning and research.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: The Campus has virtual classrooms where students can find their course instructors, tutor and fellow students, as well as their activities, materials and tools for learning.

StudentLife.label: Student clubs
StudentLife.value: The UOC's graduate community, Alumni, was created in 2008. UOC Alumni seeks to provide an interface between graduates and university, with the goal of becoming an effective platform to enable former students to contact other people they studied with, professional colleagues, teachers and faculties. Furthermore, the UOC's graduate community facilitates access to lifelong learning and professional upgrades.

name: University of Huddersfield Distance Learning Unit

About.label: History
About.value: The origins of the University of Huddersfield can be traced back to the 19th century. We have a strong focus on quality teaching and student experience and have received numerous accolades recognising this. In 2013, we were named Times Higher Education University of the Year. In 2017, we were the first university to win the Global Teaching Excellence Award. More recently, the University was awarded an outstanding Gold rating in the Teaching Excellence Framework 2023.

About.label: Education
About.value: Distance learning, also known as ‘online learning’ is where you study a course online. This gives you the flexibility to study anywhere, anytime, and conveniently fit your studies around other commitments such as work and family.At Huddersfield, your online teaching and learning takes place through Brightspace, an industry leading Virtual Learning Environment. And you’ll be taught by experienced academics, many of whom are research-active, pioneers in their respective fields. In fact, our staff rank in the top three in England for the proportion who hold doctorates, have higher degrees and hold teaching qualifications (HESA 2022). We are also first in the country for National Teaching Fellowships, which mark the UK’s best lecturers in Higher Education, winning a total of 22 since 2008 (2023 data).

About.label: Research
About.value: The University is committed to the pursuit of research on a global scale. This was recognised in the latest Research Excellence Framework where we were ranked in the top 50 UK universities for Research Power, and three quarters of all our research was recognised as world leading and internationally excellent (REF 2021).Huddersfield is home to a range of research centres and institutes working to address global challenges. We also have a Graduate School for postgraduate researchers, which provides tailored support and opportunities to maximise your potential.Some of our research degrees can be studied via distance learning too.

About.label: Career
About.value: We have an impressive record for graduate employment, with 96% of our undergraduate and 97.8% of postgraduate students in work or further study within fifteen months after graduating (HESA Graduate Outcomes 2020/21, UK domiciled, other activities excluded).

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: Careers and EmployabilityStudents can book free online appointments with our knowledgeable Careers Advisers and have online access to a 24/7 e-guidance service for quick questions, CV/application guidance and feedback. You’ll also have access to our online JobShop, where you can browse work experience and paid employment opportunities. When you graduate, you can make use of our 'here for life' offer of lifetime careers support.WellbeingTogetherall is our 24/7 online support network which you can use to access confidential advice, peer support and dedicated support programmes.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: Through our online library, you’ll have access to 523,000 electronic books and 125,000 journals covering a wide array of subject areas. We also have subject specialist librarians who you can contact online, as well as a 24/7 IT Support helpline.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: IT support is the first point of contact for all your University-related IT problems. For issues requiring an immediate response, we're available by phone, 24 hours a day, on 01484 473737.If you are using Microsoft Teams, you can call us by searching for IT Support AA in the contacts list, or by directly dialling our telephone number.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: The University of Huddersfield campus is home to a range of exciting top-class facilities, with a second National Health Innovation Campus currently under construction.Whilst you won’t be studying on campus as a distance learning student, you’ll have the opportunity to come onto campus for your graduation. Here, you’ll be able to meet your tutors and coursemates in-person and explore our beautiful campus, its facilities and the surrounding area.

About.label: History
About.value: Long Island University (LIU) was founded in 1926. The university is committed to providing a high quality education through teaching excellence and impactful research opportunities.

About.label: Education
About.value: LIU over 275 undergraduate, graduate, and doctoral degree programs, educating nearly 15,000 students each year across multiple campuses. The University cultivates academic, professional, artistic, and co-curricular opportunities.

About.label: Research
About.value: Globally impactful research and educational programming prepares LIU graduates for 21st Century challenges and opportunities.

About.label: Career
About.value: LIU Global spans eight countries on five continents, preparing students for careers as global leaders in business, policy, humanitarian relief, social entrepreneurship, economic development, and environmental sustainability.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: LIU Post's Enrollment Services team is here to provide solutions to your everyday academic needs. From registration to bursar to financial aid to academic advising, our one-stop shop is here to serve undergraduate, graduate, and transfer students.

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: LIU Post is a scenic, historic, and scholarly campus that offers a small-school environment with the access and resources of a major metropolitan university.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: The B. Davis Schwartz Memorial Library provides convenient and effective access to resources such as books, library catalog, electronic databases and scientific journals.

Services.label: ICT services
Services.value: Information technology resources are provided by the University to support its educational and research mission. Use of University information technology resources is a privilege. Accordingly, all users of the University’s networks, systems and equipment are responsible for the proper use and protection of these resources, consistent with University policies and applicable law.

Services.label: Medical services
Services.value: Long Island University has partnered with Gallagher Student Health & Special Risk to develop a cost-effective Student Health Insurance Plan that provides our students and families with robust medical coverage at school, back home, and while traveling or studying abroad.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: The University's 330-acre campus is located on the estate of Marjorie Merriweather Post, 27 miles east of New York City on Long Island's Gold Coast. The campus houses the College of Veterinary Medicine, the first professional School of Accountancy, an AACSB-accredited Business School, and an award-winning theater program. LIU is home to the world-renowned Tilles Center for the Performing Arts and the Bethpage Federal Credit Union Stadium, where supporters gather to cheer on the Sharks’ Division I athletic program.

StudentLife.label: Sports facilities
StudentLife.value: The state-of-the-art Steinberg Wellness Center provides activities that promote good health and encourage wellness behaviors that improve the quality of life for members of the campus community and the community at large, including:The center houses a 2,500-seat arena that hosts home games for our NCAA Division I athletic teams as well as intramural sports and activities; an NCAA-regulation swimming pool.

StudentLife.label: Student clubs
StudentLife.value: With more than 60 active student clubs, organizations, and athletic teams, there is something for everyone at LIU Post.

About.label: History
About.value: The University of Tuscia was founded in 1979 and quickly developed into what it is today: the hub of culture and learning in the province, offering courses suited to the requirements of local, national and international students.

About.label: Education
About.value: The educational activities are managed by six Departments offering 19 undergraduate programmes, 20 second level degree programmes and 2 single cycle degree programmes. Our degree programmes are tailored to meet the demands of the European and international job markets.Our university offers seven PhD programmes and several first and second level degree courses, as well as schools of specialization.

Services.label: Student services
Services.value: This is the administration office where information about enrolment in undergraduate and postgraduate programmes is available. The student office staff can help with online applications.

Services.label: Housing services
Services.value: The Mobility Cooperation and International Office can help you find an accommodation.LAZIODISCO (Regional body for the right to study and the promotion of knowledge) gives Erasmus students the opportunity to apply for a room at the University Student's Hostel, located in via Cardarelli, 77 - Viterbo. The Residence has only 58 rooms available for Erasmus students and they will be assigned to the first applicants. Accommodation at the University Student's Hostel is not guaranteed. Filling out the Accommodation Form is mandatory to apply to reserve a room and it is a compulsory attachment to the Application Form.

Services.label: Library services
Services.value: The University Library System boasts over 250.000 volumes, including monographs, magazines and a film collection. The online public access catalogue data is integrated within the global World Cat catalogue. Users can access the library services following their subscription in their own campus

Services.label: Medical services
Services.value: The Italian National Health Service is called “Servizio Sanitario Nazionale” (SSN) and is divided into local Healthcare Boards (“Aziende Unità Sanitarie Locali - AUSL”).If you are a EU citizen, you must bring your European Health Insurance Card - EHIC in order to access medical care. For some specialist services, the payment of a “ticket” is required, as a contribution.

StudentLife.label: Campus life
StudentLife.value: The synergy between our University and the local institutions has allowed four university campuses to develop. Three campuses are located in the historical city centre. They are the result of remarkable restoration projects on the Church of San Carlo, the Church of Santa Maria del Paradiso, and the Dominican Convent of Santa Maria in Gradi, housing the University administrative offices. Two more campuses are located in Rieti (RI) and Civitavecchia (RM).

StudentLife.label: Sports facilities
StudentLife.value: Centro Universitario Sportivo  CUS (sports centre) - CUS is the largest sports centre in Viterbo serving students of the University of Tuscia and offers the possibility to play over 30 different sports, whether at competitive or amateur level. CUS Viterbo organizes sports activities for all students and promotes the concept of physical education and leisure time activities. CUS runs the sport facilities located on the University Campuses.

StudentLife.label: Student clubs
StudentLife.value: A.S.E.S. – E.S.N. Erasmus and International Students Association and Erasmus Student Network, Viterbo. Aim: to promote international university exchange programmes.University Forestry Students’ Association - AUSF Aim: to raise awareness and further analyse the issues concerning the world of forestry.University Theatre Centre CUT  Aim: to develop awareness of the world of theatre and entertainment.Association ‘Universo Giovani’ (‘Youth Universe’) Aim: to increase the students’ cultural, social and professional skills and to offer activities designed to promote success in the job market.Association ‘Univercity Viterbo’ Aim: to design projects aimed at creating a permanent cultural interface in the city of Viterbo

About.label: Education
About.value: OPIT is led by a team with strong and 360° experience in Higher Education on an international level. We are obsessed with providing you with a value you can't find elsewhere.

About.label: Career
About.value: Our practice-oriented studies are designed to best prepare you for your future career and open up a broad array of computer science careers.  A faculty of business experts, employers in attendance, and a team of career counselors will teach you important industry insights and in-demand employment skills. They will also help you plan your career for your next big move.

Reviews.title: professional and objective
Reviews.content: Create a climate of personal development and professional integration. Favor the exchange of opinions between students and encourage the expression of all. Motivate students to undertake the proposed activities. Allow students to have a fair view of the profession. Provide students with the means to evaluate their professional orientation with honesty and objectivity.

Reviews.title: University and Technology Institute review
Reviews.content: University and Technology Institute of Boulogne-sur-Mer is a small school. So it's easier to make friends and have a social life. The teachers know us and pay attention to our absences and grades. It's a bit like high school in that respect. The building is not very new, but the work rooms are well equipped to meet the needs of the students.

Reviews.title: Ostim technical university review
Reviews.content: Ostim Technical University offers a comprehensive and practical education in various fields of technology, with experienced faculty and modern facilities, preparing students for successful careers in their chosen industries.
